Description:
A survey of the role of human service technologists, their professional and ethical responsibilities, employment
 possibilities and avenues for professional advancement.

The structure and function of groups, focusing on problem solving and communication in human service
 agencies, including chemical dependency.

A survey of providers at the federal, regional, state and local levels, including services provided and regulations
 of private and public agencies.

The dynamics of helping relationship in human services agencies. Skill development in listening and provision of
 assistance to clients is emphasized.
An introduction to the evaluation of client needs and assessment of client condition.

Course Name: CLIENT ADVOCACY AND CASE MANAGEMENT IN HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS
Description:
Assessment of case management strategies with an emphasis on the role of
the client advocate in the human
 service setting.

Course Name: INTERNSHIP IN HUMAN SERVICES TECHNOLOGY I
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Supervised field experience in a human service agency totalling 315 hours. Joint
 university-agency supervision.

Course Name: SPECIAL TOPICS IN HUMAN SERVICES TECHNOLOGY
Prerequisites: None.2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
Description: (Repeatable for credit) Discussion of a major topic within human services.

Course Name: INTERNSHIP IN HUMAN SERVICES TECHNOLOGY II
Description:
(Repeatable for credit)Continued supervised field experience in a human services agency totaling 315 hours.
 Joint university-agency supervision.
